verses.verse: Therefore they shall be like the morning cloud And like the early dew that passes away, (Ps. 1:4; Is. 17:13; Dan. 2:35) Like chaff blown off from a threshing floor And like smoke from a chimney.
“Yet (Is. 43:11) I am the LORD your God Ever since the land of Egypt, And you shall know no God but Me; For (Is. 43:11; 45:21, 22; (1 Tim. 2:5)) there is no savior besides Me.
(Deut. 2:7; 32:10) I knew you in the wilderness, (Deut. 8:15) In the land of great drought.
(Deut. 8:12, 14; 32:13-15; Jer. 5:7) When they had pasture, they were filled; They were filled and their heart was exalted; Therefore they forgot Me.
“So (Lam. 3:10; Hos. 5:14) I will be to them like a lion; Like (Jer. 5:6) a leopard by the road I will lurk;
I will meet them (2 Sam. 17:8; Prov. 17:12) like a bear deprived of her cubs; I will tear open their rib cage, And there I will devour them like a lion. The wild beast shall tear them.
“O Israel, you are destroyed, But your help is from Me.
I will be your King; (Deut. 32:38) Where is any other, That he may save you in all your cities? And your judges to whom (1 Sam. 8:5, 6) you said, ‘Give me a king and princes’?
(1 Sam. 8:7; 10:17-24) I gave you a king in My anger, And took him away in My wrath.
